##A young man riding his motorcycle home thought of Hayao Miyazaki on the way

Wechat media-fox

Features, for those who insist on serious reading options. Sohu News Extreme Day studio.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Editor's Note: On January 12,2020, Li Xiaogang, a migrant worker in Zhongshan, Guangdong Province, took his wife on a rally motorcycle and began a 1,400 kilometer journey home. At the time, there were no masks on the road, and Li's return was a common sight in the Spring Festival travel rush in China. A week later, the COVID-19 epidemic spread. In order to reduce population movements and control the epidemic, some people were unable to return home for the festival. But for the Chinese at the moment, the road home is like Li Xiaogang's journey, separated by two places, heart to heart, though it must come far. "Polar Day" wish each reader can be like Li Xiaogang, arrive safely, happy and well-being.

Kevin | Ko Kai
Editor | Peng Lin

On January 12, the third day of the Spring Festival travel rush, Li Xiaogang, a migrant worker in Zhongshan, Guangdong Province, took his wife on a rally motorcycle and drove her more than 1,400 kilometers to her hometown in Luzhou, Sichuan Province. It was his 15th year in Zhongshan and he was part of the "motorcyclist army" for the first time.

The earliest return home can be traced back to the Spring Festival transportation in 2000. Some migrant workers in the Pearl River Delta travel in groups, riding back to their hometown of Guangxi, Guizhou, Hunan and Sichuan for the Spring Festival. In 2008, migrant workers on the road attracted media attention during the Spring Festival travel period. Many migrant workers in Wuzhou city of Guangxi Province passed through the area on their way west. There were 130,000 motorcycles passing through the area, and they became known as the "motorcycle army" .

According to statistics from Wuzhou's traffic police detachment, the number of "motorcyclists" dropped to around 30,000 during the Spring Festival travel season this year, reaching a peak of 300,000 in 2013. Those who choose to ride on the road, such as Li Xiaogang, born in the 1990s, are no longer interested in riding motorcycles just because "a ticket is hard to get" . They originally planned it as a "journey" when they cycled back home.

"there are fewer factories to expand and renovate, and jobs are getting harder to find, " said Li Xiaogang, a former worker in Zhongshan who plans to move to another province in the spring. He has traveled from Zhongshan to Luzhou for 15 years, and 2020 may be his last, these years of "wide drift" career, on the return of a motorcycle to draw a full stop. Like everyone else on the road, Li Xiaogang, 30, took a short break at the end of the year before continuing to make a living in his hometown and the next far away.

Here's what Li Xiaogang said:

1

I have a rally car that I bought last August for sixteen thousand bucks. It is higher than the average motorcycle chassis, can run mountain road.

I like mountain running. There is a mountain in Zhongshan, where I go with my friends from my cycling group. We can see the scenery and breathe the fresh air. In addition to satisfying hobbies, this car can be used in normal working hours, the maximum speed of the car is 117kmh, in urban areas, I usually control the speed from 30kmh to 50kmh. It's low on gas. It runs through the city at 12 cents a mile.

I've been meaning to take my bike home for the new year. On January 12 this year, at 7 a.m. , I rode it north from Zhongshan to Foshan, where I met up with two other villagers who were riding motorcycles back to Sichuan, and then headed west at around 10 a.m. , officially setting off for home, with my wife and live reporters from the Beijing News, there are nine of us.

In early January, the reporter contacted me and said that he wanted to follow a couple on a motorcycle to return home for the Spring Festival. The set departure date was the 12th. I do water electrician, pick up some scattered small businesses, small workshop of Water and Electricity Decoration, do a day to get a day's salary, holiday time can set themselves. My wife works in a garment factory. There are often clients who issue orders at the end of the year, saying that they want to rush work and sell New Year goods. The date of their vacation is postponed along with it. Fortunately, this year the boss relented, saying that after the 10,000 items received in January, they will go on vacation. They rushed, and finished by the 12th.

After riding a motorcycle for more than a dozen times, we agreed to take the Fukun line, through Jiangmen, Guigang and Hechi, and then directly onto the highway from Mawei Toll Station in Guizhou, all the way north to Renhuai and then to Sichuan.

Last year, on the Fourth of July holiday, I went in the opposite direction, riding a motorcycle from my hometown to Zhongshan. That time take Xia Rong highway directly, from Guizhou Renhuai into, Guangxi Guilin Out, during the holiday highway free of charge. I wasn't in a hurry, and I didn't have any specific plans. Instead, I would tour the scenic spots, find some local snacks, and eat my friends'powder, Mallard Duck, and Turtle Jelly paste from Wuzhou. I walked almost the whole way on the highway. It only took me two days.

Li Xiaogang checks his motorcycle before returning home. Photo taken on the Internet

This time with his wife, it is winter, riding slowly, generally run 40 km / h to 60 km / h speed, half a day down there is an hour to run 70 km / h. We set out at seven in the morning and stopped at seven or eight in the evening at the towns we passed. The first three days walk 400 kilometers a day, the last day off the highway in Guizhou, walked about 270 kilometers, 15 back to his hometown of Luxian Hongtan village.

Every hour or two on the road, we had to stop and rest for 10 minutes. The strongest feeling is cold, the next day after Hechi began to drizzle, I put on four pairs of pants, still cold. Drizzle is very difficult to form water droplets, to occasionally use gloves to wipe off the rain on the mask, later because of the temperature difference between inside and outside the helmet is too big, always fog, can only open the mask, face exposed outside, the rain has been drilling into the eyes, when getting out of the car, my eyes are bloodshot.

That day also originally intended to stop when it was dark, but the traffic police in Guangxi looked foggy and rainy. They were already waiting for us 20 kilometers ahead and were ready to make way for us. We got to their station and were escorted to the border of Guangxi and Guizhou, then walked 10 kilometers to Mawei town in Guizhou, where we found a place to sleep at 11:30 pm.

My wife was wearing a black raincoat. The more I looked at her, the more I thought she looked like a Zongzi. She was in the back seat, unable to move her arms and legs, and it was so cold, I was afraid she wouldn't be able to resist before she got into the reporter's car.

Although the weather is bad, but the company, did not find it difficult to get through. I like to ride a motorcycle myself. It gives a feeling of freedom and freedom. A person riding a bike, ears only "boom" the wind, feel that they really belong to themselves, Sing Ah, roar, no one will care.

I was also impressed by the white-cut chicken from Ping<loc_0> , Guigang, Guangxi. Even though I'm from Sichuan, I've been in Guangdong for more than ten years, and my taste has faded. I like to eat Guangdong powder, boiling water, powder hot on 15 to 20 seconds, add a little seasoning into the daily breakfast.

2

We usually go home for Chinese New Year, most of the time by bus. Where I come from, there are many people working in Zhongshan. There are more than a dozen people in my village alone. Zhongshan has a bus that takes you directly to Lu County. It has 53 seats. Tickets are priced at 80 yuan at the cheapest time, the price went up sharply around the beginning of school and the end of the year.

In 2009, my parents were still working in Zhongshan, my wife came home for the first time, the ticket price rose to 560 yuan, the four of us spent more than 5,000 yuan on the New Year bus. The bus usually leaves at 4 a.m. and arrives in Lu County at noon the next day, and it's not just because you can't get a train ticket. Every year, people would leave and come home with pots and pans, which would be difficult to carry on the train, but the buses were acceptable, packed in the ground floor cars, and charged only 30 or 50 yuan for the extra stuff.

This ride home is planned for a long time, I am also technically skilled, not too worried, but the road or almost encounter danger.

On the highway, a Black Volkswagen sedan, straddled two lanes from the left before entering the service area, ran over the fairway in front of me. The back of his car was less than a meter from the front tire of my motorcycle. If I was going fast, I would have crashed. What's that saying? Other people are meat wrapped in iron, our motorcycle is meat wrapped in iron, we can only be extremely careful.

The situation is more complicated on state and provincial roads. We often see some vans, cars through the junction, whether single yellow line, double yellow line, straight on the U-TURN. When passing through Guangxi, I would pass some villages and towns. I drove slowly and didn't dare to honk the horn. Because is a foreigner, played the trumpet, If really encounter insolent unreasonable, not happy, directly fell in front of me, that is really a hundred mouths to contend with. Sometimes adults in the market to buy things, the child was not held, suddenly ran into the middle of the road, is also very dangerous, so meet this section can not be rushed.

After getting off the highway from Guizhou, we went to Sichuan Province and walked a section of mountain road. The terrain was more troublesome. The roads were almost built on mountains, curved and narrow. We happened to meet a group of lorries. As they walked, they cooled the brake pads, we did not dare to overtake, the Motorcycle Horn is small, the van may not hear our horn, so has been following behind.

It's like when you ride a bike, your mind is so far away. In Wuzhou, Guangxi, I saw a project team in the mountains quarrying, the dust is very big, the next field of crops can not live, will think of Hayao Miyazaki cartoon. Can the environment really be destroyed to the extent that it is in the film? Everyone wears a mask, or a headgear, and the children see blue skies, white clouds, and green trees only through their textbooks or computers. On second thought, why isn't this place regulated? I also think of my own work, I also do urban construction, urban construction needs these raw materials, there is no better technology means to intervene to produce these raw materials, it can only be locally sourced.

The weather is good, I thought, wait do not know what can be seen in the roadside stalls, do not know what can buy food. When it rains, it's hard to know when it's going to clear up and where to ride.

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
Mr. and Mrs. Li Xiaogang on their way home

3

Because I was chosen by the reporter to follow the film, in our village People's opinion, I was also kind of famous.

It's just that I'm home with my wife, and I'm on the 12th, which is exactly what they need for the shoot. Just arrived home that two days, the village people meet said: "This is famous. " I said: "famous, not that name? "

If buying a welfare lottery ticket and winning $5 million can make me happy for two or three years, fame is a short-term thing, not uncommon. Like a few years ago when we were prospecting for oil here, when foreign experts came, and planes were flying over our heads all the time, the villagers were very curious, and I said, "what's the matter? I don't want to take my land and drive me to the city. "

In the city is not free, I am in the Home Speaker how loud, no one to complain. The city is the direction of development, but I belong to the countryside, the countryside just give me a sense of security, let people relax, the city is too nervous. Our decorator went to work in the city community, see people parking and to rob a parking space, very troublesome. In my yard, when friends and family come over, it's not just to stop you?

In Zhongshan, we had a bad year. Sometimes I only get a week or two a month, and I can't make four thousand bucks a month. Last New Year's Day, I received a factory in Dongguan, the factory Gate Guard said: "You see now 100 people are less than, we used to have a lot of people. "

Perhaps because the state pays attention to environmental protection, the economic benefits of Guangdong's factories in the last two years are not as good as before, indirectly resulting in our casual workers do not work. Remember 2015,2016, the money factory is always to renovate, we always have something to do. There are many to expand the scale, five hundred square plant, 3,4 people to do water and electricity renovation, about a dozen days to do, I almost every month to receive two or three orders, do 30 days. Now not only renovation, expansion of the less, even routine maintenance, such as repair fans, light bulbs, these are also less, will be used to control costs.

So I spent some time last year looking for work outside the city. In August, after buying a motorcycle in my hometown, I received a job in Yulin, Guangxi. I went there by bike and worked there for half a month before returning home. In October, I cycled from home to Zhongshan. I thought, I should leave Guangdong in 2020, and the bike must be cycled back. It is big and costs more than 800 yuan to use logistics.

Li was accompanied by two fellow Sichuan villagers. Image courtesy of the web

Last year, I didn't want to go back to Guangdong, but working in my hometown, I could only make 200 yuan a day. After gas and living expenses, I could hardly make 150 yuan, which was less than my budget. Two days ago, my cousin came back from vacation, said there are two construction site, one in Jiangxi, one in Shanxi, may be the end of the year I set where to go.

Guangdong has seen too much worldly wisdom, saying it is bitter.

In October 2018, I was working on a nail, and the nail blew out at the end, and there was debris in my eye, and I thought it was sand, and I didn't care, and then I started bleeding, and then I went to the hospital and I called the foreman, and they didn't pick up. We didn't sign employment contract, we didn't have health insurance, no one could prove I was working there, people on the construction site even said, "I didn't ask you to come, I don't know who you are, " and I ended up paying $13,000 in medical bills myself.

A few years earlier, I'd lost four road bikes in a row, each costing $350. The security guard also does not care, I said to the boss: "Do not do, you do this for a month, have to take half a month's salary to buy a bicycle. " The boss said: "I give you to lose one. " Also insisted on doing a week, the bicycle did not compensate me, I went to resign, the boss was not happy: "It is not nothing to do for you, you work an extra hour every day, do a few days and can buy a bicycle. "

When I first came to Zhongshan, I was 15 years old, still in grade one. At that time, my parents both worked in Shaxi town, Zhongshan. My mother cut threads in a garment factory. My father worked on a construction site. I heard in my hometown that they were going to divorce and was anxious to find them. I stayed like this and found a job in a garment factory, over $1,100 on the payroll.

In our junior middle school class, 90% of all the students who came out to work came to Guangdong. At that time, there are some rebellious mentality, thinking about making friends, living an adult life, and so after the youth of the muddled period, 18 or 19 years old, began to think about making money, everything else is not so important, money to talk hard, do not look at the face of others.

In fact, according to my previous plan, the last trip from Zhongshan to Lu County should go like this: starting from Guangdong on the 12th, finishing Guangxi on the 13th, going to Guizhou Zunyi for a while, and then setting off for Sichuan to climb the Zigzag Mountain, if you can climb it, if the body is not high, it will be ready to go to Lhasa on 318(National Highway) in the future. Come down from the mountains to Zigong, where brine wells produce salt, better nutrition, come down from Zigong to Yongchuan District, with Yongchuan District's friends a day, 19 or 20 back home.

But the project was put on hold because it had to fit in with the theme of "homecoming" and there was no detours. One of the perks of seeing your son a few days earlier.

My son's in the second grade. His grandma usually carries it. I used to be a left-behind child, and now I feel even more sorry for him when I go out to work for a long time. Once at a parent-teacher conference, the teacher asked the parents to attend, do not allow the grandmother to replace, I pushed the work to, deliberately waiting. See other people's parents accompany the children to school, birthday, he did not, he sad, I also sad.

But he knows what he's doing. Last October, when I was riding my motorcycle to Zhongshan, he asked me, "will you be back from there? " Now, every morning, grandma takes him on her bike for 20 minutes to school, and for such a short distance, he feels cold and knows he will doze off on the way, "It's too cold to ride a bike, " he said. "Put the bike on the coach and pull it back. "
